body.p:
To His Exelency
Thos E Bramlett
Govenor of Kentucky

Your Petitioners would Respectfully Represent that Wm R Holbrook while a Private Soldier in the 14th Ky Vol Inft had a dificulty with Floyd Roberts a Citizen all Parties under influence of Ardent Spirits In the fray Holbrook Concieving that Roberts was Drawing a Pistol Shot at and wounded Roberts Slightly in the Left Arm a Flesh wound which has not injured Roberts. Holbrook has paid Roberts $150,00 as Damage and permitted a fine of $100.00 to go vs him Last Circuit Court The Sheriff has Levied upon him his Land the Only Property has to pay with and that is advertised for Sale The 3rd Monday in Dec

Holbrook has a Family of a wife & 6 Children and a Shattered Constitution The Result of his Service in the Cause
of his Country
If his Land is sold He & his Family must Suffer and he has no Other means of Paying it & has only 200 aces of LMountain Land 15 aces cleared and a Log Cabin

We would Ernestly Represent that this is a case that adresses itself to your Exelencys Clemency and believe in Consideration of his Services as a Soldier and his Former Good character as a Peacable Quiet Citizen should appeal to him for the Remitting of his Fine

Yours Most Respectfuly
Linsey Leter
